business.headline: When nursery fees need an EMI: CoinSwitch co-founder flags new middle-class crisisOnce believed to be the key to a better life, schooling today has ironically become the heaviest expense for India's middle-class families, who are struggling to keep up, says Ashish Singhal, co-founder of CoinSwitch.

Nvidia now worth nearly as much as India's economy. Details hereAccording to the International Monetary Fund (IMF), India's gross domestic product is currently estimated at $4.2 trillion and is expected to touch $4.27 trillion by the end of 2025.

3 key reasons behind Bitcoin's record high todayAt the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $111,019.74, rising by 2.27% over the past day. The last record was set on May 22 when it briefly touched $111,970. Since then, Bitcoin has had a bumpy ride, but it seems to be back with a bang.

TCS to announce Q1 results today: Here's what to expect from the IT giantTCS Q1 results: Apart from growth numbers, the market will also watch for any announcements on interim dividends, updates on client budgets in sectors like banking, retail, and manufacturing, and comments on the pace of new deal wins.
Sensex opens 85 points higher, Nifty above 25,400; Tata Steel up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 43.60 points to 83,492.48, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.90 points to 25,460.20 as of 9:28 am.

Bitcoin rockets to a record high, just shy of $112,000. Here's whyAs Bitcoin's market cap has crossed into the trillions, more institutional investors are entering the space. Large firms that once stayed away are now taking positions in digital assets, helping push prices higher.

Travel Food Services allotment: Step-by-step to check allotment statusInvestors can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).

Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to hit $4 trillion in market valueNvidia's market cap now exceeds the combined value of the Canadian and Mexican stock markets. It is also larger than the total market capitalisation of all publicly listed companies in the UK, according to LSEG data.

Emirates signs deal to accept crypto payments for flight bookings: ReportIn recent years, the UAE has grown into a popular place for crypto companies. Many crypto firms have opened offices there or are planning to expand. Today, people in the UAE can already use cryptocurrencies to pay for things like real estate, school fees and even transport services.
Sensex closes 176 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HCLTech down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 176.43 points to 83,536.08, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 46.40 points to 25,476.10 as of 3:47 pm.

Reliance Jio IPO hits pause button, 2025 listing unlikely: ReportReliance Industries shares fell sharply after the news and were down 1.8% in afternoon trade, dragging the broader market into negative territory.

Sebi's ban on Jane Street: Could it rattle Dalal Street?While the ban is focused on a single player, many believe it may have wider effects on liquidity, trading volumes, investor confidence, and even foreign investor behaviour.

entertainment.headline: Mohit Suri: I was very upset when Awarapan didn't do well | ExclusiveMohit Suri, in an exclusive chat, shared that he was disappointed with Awarapan's poor box office performance. Fans have been asking for a re-release of the film.

It wasn't always like this: Rajkummar Rao on dealing with public gaze, pap cultureActor Rajkummar Rao remains a private individual amidst growing fame, choosing to keep his personal life away from the public eye while appreciating the media's respectful approach. He finds solace in genuine connections and the freedom of acting, with exciting projects like 'Maalik' and a new chapter in his personal life on the horizon.

Ekta Kapoor breaks silence on why Kyunki after 25 years: To bring change, inspireEkta Kapoor asks the audience and fans of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' to trust her and the team of the show. She shared a big note explaining why she decided to bring back the show after 25 years despite its huge legacy that is feared to be ruined.

Former NCT member Taeil sentenced to 3.5 years in prison for sexual assaultFormer NCT member Taeil sentenced to three-and-a-half years for aggravated sexual assault involving a foreign victim. The case raises concerns about exploitation and legal consequences for celebrities in South Korea.

Sudhanshu Pandey vs Apoorva Mukhija gets messy, actor slams her for delulu dramaSudhanshu Pandey hit back at influencer Apoorva Mukhija after their fallout on 'The Traitors', calling her someone who "thrives on drama" and "clickbait." Without naming her, he accused her of milking their on-screen spat for relevance.

In Anurag Basu's Metro... In Dino, feminism looks like everyday womenMetro In Dino feminism is distinct, beautiful and relevant. Anurag Basu designs characters who choose themselves, break conventions and decide to make mistakes of their own kind. Sara Ali Khan, Neena Gupta, Konkona Sensharma, Fatima Sana Shaikh and even the teenage girl - all seem relatable and quietly powerful.

Kajol's one tip to star kids: Unlearn and reinventActor Kajol recently expressed her views on the do-or-die situation for star kids. She also reflected on the trolling and the way forward for young actors in the present scenario.

Rasha Thadani congratulates Shanaya Kapoor after her debut film premiereRasha Thadani extended her support to Shanaya Kapoor at the premiere of 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan'. She greeted the debutante with a warm hug and praised her performance.

Superman review: James Gunn brings the fun back to David Corenswet-led DC heroRelease Date:Fri Jul 11, 2025Superman movie review: James Gunn's new 'Superman' film revives the superhero with a perfect mix of humour and heart, focusing on identity and hope. Featuring David Corenswet and Rachel Brosnahan, the film is a vibrant, feel-good tribute to the Man of Steel.

Did Akshay Kumar use teleprompter for Kannappa? Internet thinks soAkshay Kumar seemed to have used a teleprompter on the sets of 'Kannappa', in which he played the role of Lord Shiva. Internet dug out a video, which is now going on social media, where Kumar is seemingly reading his lines from the teleprompter.

Will Smith to The Rock: Actors who are likely to be part of Allu Arjun-Atlee filmDirector Atlee and actor Allu Arjun are working on a mega-budget sci-fi film, produced by Sun Pictures. Will Smith, Dwayne Johnson (The Rock), Rashmika Mandanna and several others are rumoured to be part of the star-studded cast.

Salman Khan steps out with high security to attend Sangeeta Bijlani's birthday bashSalman Khan attended his ex-girlfriend Sangeeta Bijlani's birthday party in Mumbai on Wednesday. He arrived at the venue with high security.

Dubai Royal Sheikha Mahra, French Montana spark dating rumours in ParisSheikha Mahra and French Montana sparked dating rumors after being seen together in Paris. Instagram posts and past Dubai outings fuelled speculation, following Mahra's high-profile divorce and business launch.

HBO Max returns: Warner Bros. drops 'Max' rebrand after backlashWarner Bros. Discovery has rebranded Max back to HBO Max, citing the strong legacy and consumer loyalty tied to the HBO name, after the Max brand failed to resonate with audiences.

Wednesday Season 2 trailer out: Jenna Ortega returns with darker twistWednesday Season 2 trailer teases dark twists, new characters, and Jenna Ortega's return. Steve Buscemi joins as principal, Joanna Lumley debuts as Grandmama, and global "Doom Tour" promotions kick off.

Diljit Dosanjh shares new BTS from Border 2, Varun Dhawan-Ahan Shetty make cameoDespite the row over his casting in 'Border 2', Diljit Dosanjh seems unfazed. The actor is enjoying himself on set, as seen in his latest video.

Who was Humaira Asghar Ali, the Pakistani actor found dead at home?Pakistani actor and model Humaira Asghar Ali was found dead in her Karachi apartment, with the cause of death still under investigation. Known for her roles in TV dramas and the film 'Jalaibee', she gained fame through the reality show 'Tamasha Ghar'.

Siddu Jonnalagadda turns raw and intense for Badass, makers unveil posterAfter the massive success of the 'Tillu' franchise, Siddu Jonnalagadda is set to shed the lingering image with 'Badass', a raw, intense film directed by Ravikanth Perepu. The makers released the first-look poster recently.

Slow Horses renewed: Gary Oldman's spy-thriller upgraded for seventh seasonActor Gary Oldman's British spy-thriller series 'Slow Horses' has been renewed for the seventh season. The show is based on Mick Herron's spy novel series 'Slough House'.

general news.headline: Exercise not the problem, timing is: Supreme Court on Bihar voter roll revisionHearing a clutch of petitions challenging the Election Commission's decision, the Supreme Court said the poll watchdog had a mandate under the Constitution to conduct the exercise.

Siddaramaiah shuts leadership change buzz: Seat not empty, here for 5 yearsAmid swirling speculation over a leadership change in Karnataka, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah told India Today TV he will remain in office for a full five-year term and lead Congress into 2028 polls.

Extrajudicial killings, torture: Shashi Tharoor's stinging op-ed on EmergencyShashi Tharoor, in the op-ed, highlighted how the world remained unaware of the horrific realities during the Emergency, including custodial torture and extrajudicial killings.

What India's Gini score says about economic welfarism and its successThe Gini Index ranges in value from 0 to 100. A score of 0 means perfect equality. A score of 100 means perfect inequality. The higher the Gini Index, the more unequal the country.

She shared a big note explaining why she decided to bring back the show after 25 years despite its huge legacy that is feared to be ruined.

South Indians run dance bars...: Sena MLA's fresh slur after viral assault videoSanjay Gaikwad, a two-term legislator from Buldhana, was caught on video slapping and punching a canteen contractor at the Akashwani MLA residence in Mumbai for allegedly serving stale food.

3rd Test preview: Bazball on trial as buoyant India smell blood at Lord'sEngland vs India, 3rd Test preview: Bazball swagger has given way to uncertainty as England reel from India's Edgbaston onslaught. With Bumrah returning at Lord's, cricket's grandest stage braces for Bazball's sternest examination yet.

Man arrested for filming women on Bengaluru streets, posting videos without consentA woman called out an Instagram account for secretly filming women in popular areas in Bengaluru without consent and posting them online. After her video went viral, police arrested 26-year-old Gurudeep Singh for posting the reels and harassing women.

Featuring David Corenswet and Rachel Brosnahan, the film is a vibrant, feel-good tribute to the Man of Steel.

Job applicant's hilarious half-printed resume says 'Hire me to unlock full potential'A Reddit post on the popular subreddit r/recruitinghell with the title, "Resume printed halfway and said: 'Hire me to unlock full potential', has gone viral.

Raj Thackeray to Shrinkhal Chaliha, regional fanatics attacking India's soulEven as nationalism is running high in India, groups run by linguistic chauvinists and regional fanatics are dividing Indians. Raj Thackeray and Shrinkhal Chaliha are just two of the extremists preventing decades-old wounds from healing through toxic politics that goes against the modern Indian concept of staying anywhere in India for education, business or leisure.
India's smart cities have a flooding problem. They can't handle rainThe increase in urban floods and cloudbursts over the past few years leaves little room for doubt.

Amit Shah shares post-retirement plan: Vedas, Upanishads and farmingUnion Home Minister Amit Shah recently revealed his post-retirement plans. The sixty-year-old task-master said he would immerse himself in Vedas, Upanishads, and natural farming. Citing health risks linked to the use of chemical fertilisers, Shah batted for the promotion of organic farming.

Watch: Ex-Goa Minister gets heartfelt welcome from pilot daughter on IndiGo flightFormer Goa Minister Deepak Dhavalikar was welcomed by a heartfelt announcement on board an IndiGo plane from Chennai to Goa by his daughter, Gauri Dhavalikar, who was the First Officer on the flight.

Girls stripped for period check after blood stains found in school washroomAfter spotting drops of blood in the school bathroom, the principal summoned girls from Classes 5 to 10 to the school hall for a strip-check.

Rahul Mishra blends sufism, art and Indian heritage for Paris couture showFor his Fall/Winter 2026 showcase at Paris Haute Couture Week, designer Rahul Mishra did what he does best - blending art and fashion with a generous dose of sculptural accents.

Lawrence Bishnoi gang hit with first-ever case in Rajasthan, 3 members arrestedJaipur Police have registered Rajasthan's first FIR against gangster Lawrence Bishnoi and his entire gang, marking a major step in the state's crackdown on organised crime.

IPL ticket scam: CID arrests Hyderabad cricket chief Jagan Mohan Rao, 4 othersThe Crime Investigation Department (CID) on Wednesday arrested Hyderabad Cricket Association (HCA) President A. Jagan Mohan Rao in connection with a ticketing scandal during the 2025 Indian Premier League (IPL) season.

Students protest at Kerala University over alleged saffronisation of universitiesProtests led by SFI and DYFI turned confrontational in Kerala, with police using water cannons. The intensifying campus unrest has been over the allegations of "saffronisation" in the state's higher education institutions.

ED files case against Vijay Deverakonda, Prakash Raj, 27 others in betting app scamThe Enforcement Directorate has filed a case against 29 actors and public figures, including prominent actors Vijay Deverakonda, Prakash Raj and Rana Daggubati, based on a Cyberabad police FIR into a betting app.

Supreme Court agrees to hear plea seeking halt on Kerala nurse's execution in YemenA PIL was filed in the Supreme Court seeking urgent intervention to save Kerala nurse Nimisha Priya, facing execution in Yemen. The petitioner urged diplomatic efforts to pay blood money. The Supreme Court agreed to hear the plea on July 14.

Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan premiere: Arjun Kapoor, Tabu, Raveena Tandon attendIt was a star-studded evening as Bollywood came out in full force to support Shanaya Kapoor's debut film, 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan'. Vikrant Massey, Arjun Kapoor and Vedang Raina were seen in attendance at the film's premiere.

sports.headline: Lord's Test: Jofra Archer tipped to make Pat Cummins-esque returnEngland vs India: Steve Harmison has tipped Jofra Archer to make a Pat Cummins-esque return to Test cricket after being back in the England red-ball lineup for the first time in 4 years. Archer will play in the Lord's Test against India.

IPL ticket scam: CID arrests Hyderabad cricket chief Jagan Mohan Rao, 4 othersThe Crime Investigation Department (CID) on Wednesday arrested Hyderabad Cricket Association (HCA) President A. Jagan Mohan Rao in connection with a ticketing scandal during the 2025 Indian Premier League (IPL) season.

How Sunil Gavaskar escaped becoming a good fisherman and bad batsmanSunil Gavaskar was mistakenly swapped with another baby at birth in the hospital. His uncle noticed the missing birthmark on his ear and alerted the family just in time. Had his uncle not noticed, Gavaskar might have grown up a good fisherman and a bad batsman.

Dukes ball drama and Lord's slope: ENG vs IND 3rd Test buzz explainedEngland vs India, 3rd Test: The Dukes ball has come under scrutiny in the ENG vs IND series for going soft and losing shape too quickly, frustrating bowlers and prompting calls for change. The Lord's Cricket Ground will present the two teams with another unique challenge -- the slope. Here's all that you need to know about them.

Luka Modric bids goodbye to Real Madrid after FIFA Club World Cup exitLuka Modric's 13-year journey with Real Madrid ended quietly but emotionally, as the Croatian legend made his final appearance during a 4–0 loss to PSG in the Club World Cup semi-final in New Jersey.

ENG vs IND, 3rd Test weather and pitch report: Will rain spoil Lord's clash?After rain-hit Tests in Leeds and Birmingham, fans can finally expect clear skies and uninterrupted cricket at Lord's, with forecasts predicting sunny conditions and steady temperatures throughout the third India vs England Test.

Day 11 schedule: Aryna Sabalenka, Iga Swiatek eye spot in finalWimbledon 2025: World No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka and five-time Grand Slam champion Iga Swiatek are each just one win away from a maiden Wimbledon final, but standing in their way are two resurgent forces-Amanda Anisimova and Belinda Bencic-both playing inspired tennis.

Karun Nair eyes redemption at Lord's as 2nd chance at cricket nears expiry dateHaving earned a second chance at international cricket, Karun Nair now finds himself at a crucial juncture after failing to convert his starts into big scores in the first two Tests. Another poor performance at Lord's could very well spell the end of the road for the Vidarbha batter, especially with several talented youngsters waiting in the wings.

Red Bull exit came as a shock: Christian Horner in emotional farewell speechChristian Horner has said his dismissal as Red Bull Racing's Team Principal and CEO "came as a shock", marking his first public comments since the news broke on Wednesday morning.

Messi scripts MLS history, helps Inter Miami edge New England RevolutionLionel Messi scripted MLS history with a pair of goals, leading Inter Miami to a 2-1 win over the New England Revolution on Wednesday night in Foxborough, Mass.

Lord's Test: Will the past come back to haunt under-pressure England?ENG vs IND: England haven't had a great record at Lord's in the last decade or so, especially against subcontinent teams. Ben Stokes' men will also be looking to bounce back from their 336-run loss at Edgbaston.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
